Summary: silver craft shaped like a thin cigar or missile seen in Tucson 7-13-11
divs: sighting details7-13-11 12:48pm i was driving west on speedway blvd. i first saw the unidentified craft after the intersection w\ tucson blvd. it was a silver craft in the sky shaped like a thin cigar or missile. it had no wings. at the front it had a stripe of orange metallic color. it didn���t have a ���nose��� like a plane- it was blunt. at the back end it looked either like a piece of silver metal flaring out that was brightly reflecting light or it was bright light flaring out the back. see my sketch craft.png. it was flying low, going south. i turned south on campbell and just before i reached 6th st i lost track as it descended and the view was blocked by the buildings. it was farther west. it had been flying quite fast and didn\t slow down on the descent. also, it's front didn't tip down. it stayed horizontal. at first i thought it might be headed for the airport, but it didn���t go that far south and was farther west. after looking at a map it might have landed in sentinel peak area.it looked very much like the craft i saw in this area back in may, which i also reported.my reaction was "it is broad daylight and there are a ton of cars around, is anyone else seeing this? it looks like the craft i saw before- but if it were a ufo wouldn't that be odd? there must be an explanation." i later did a search to find out if the university of arizona was doing any aviation research, but no.
